title: Ceremonial Apron and Headband (men tawe and pilu saluf)

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of a: bands of cotton, warp-faced, weft-ribbed plain weave with discontinuous wefts and weft twining and countered weft twining with continuous and discontinuous wefts; upper edge binding of cotton, plain weave; waist ties of 8-strand 1:1 oblique interlacing; main warp fringe beaded with glass beads; b: bands of cotton, warp-faced, weft-ribbed plain weave and countered weft twining with continuous and discontinuous wefts, main warp fringe.

artist_display:
Atoni people
Indonesia, Timor, Amanuban area
medium_display: a: Bands of cotton, warp-faced, weft-ribbed plain weave with discontinuous wefts and weft twining and countered weft twining with continuous and discontinuous wefts; upper edge binding of cotton, plain weave; waist ties of 8-strand 1:1 oblique interlacing; main warp fringe beaded with glass beads; b: bands of cotton, warp-faced, weft-ribbed plain weave and countered weft twining with continuous and discontinuous wefts, main warp fringe
credit_line: Gift of E. M. Bakwin Indonesian Textile Collection
publication_history: Brigette Khan Majlis, The Art of Indonesian Textiles: The E. M. Bakwin Collection at the Art Institute of Chicago, Art Institute of Chicago Museum Studies, 33, 2 (2007): 93-94, cat. 54.
exhibition_history: Art Institute of Chicago, Galleries 108-109, The Art of Indonesian Textiles: The E. M. Bakwin Collection at the Art Institute of Chicago, Dec. 1, 2007–Mar. 2, 2008, cat. 54.
provenance_text: E.M. (Pete) Bakwin, Chicago, IL, by 2002 [E.M. Bakwin Collection of Indonesian Textiles inventory EMB-11037AB, incoming receipt RX23940, dated Jan. 22, 2003, in curatorial file, Textiles Department]; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2002.

input: Ceremonial Apron and Headband (men tawe and pilu saluf)
